intro: Paraglycine upembae, commonly known as the Upemba paraglycine, is a rare and enigmatic plant species native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique morphological features, including its hairy leaves and specialized floral structures. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in dense tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species. Further research is needed to fully understand its ecological role and conservation status.
